content: Hi, how do I add the HL7 styling to this Build version of this iGuide? https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/ihe-sdc-ecc-on-fhir/index.html
You mean change the template?
I mean why is everything purple instead of red, and lacking the FHIR logos etc.
Change the template in ig.ini to ig-template-hl7.
oop, ig-template-fhir.

because you have not chosen the proper template to use. Your ig.ini says to use fhir base. you want the hl7 template.
template = hl7.fhir.template#current
@Elliot Silver @Jean Duteau that didn't work: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179297-committers.2Fnotification
The HL7 template should only be used if you're publishing the IG as part of HL7 international.
It did work :)
It failed with this message: "When using the HL7 template, the IG id must start with "hl7." - found IHE-SDC-eCC-On-FHIR"
The HL7 template enforces a bunch of rules not enforced by the base template - things we need to tie into Jira, ensuring that the IG is in fact an HL7 IG, etc.
Does that mean until the NIB is submitted it has to be purple? Unlike this IG https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-cancer-reporting-ig/
@Lloyd McKenzie should I go back to template = fhir.base.template#current ?
@Alex Goel no, it means you need to change your IG id to start with hl7. assuming that you want your guide to be balloted and published at HL7
The project is being managed by HL7 so I'll need to get some help with that https://github.com/HL7/ihe-sdc-ecc-on-fhir :)
I'll contact the webmaster
Or should it be changed to fhir-ihe-sdc-ecc?
what do you mean "managed by HL7"? you don't need to change your repository name. just the id of the IG - line 5 of your sushi-config.yaml
I thought you meant the repo name needed to be changed
no, as the error message said, the IG id needs to start with hl7.
NOTE: I suspect you'll need to update your ig.ini with the ig ID as well
Still purple, but I think that's because I have to change the template back
Thanks for the help! That worked!
im confused by the name of the project. is this an HL7 project, or an IHE one?
I'm confused too, is this an IHE or hl7 guide? Is this the hl7 SDC? , as the content doesn't look like it.
